item.title: æ°”è±¡å­¦å®¶ @ Brownï¼†Brownä¿é™©
item.description: Built on meritocracy, our unique company culture rewards self-starters and those who are committed to doing what is best for our customers.The Meteorologist will collaborate with seasoned underwriters, actuaries, and catastrophe modelers to offer meteorological expertise, conduct quantitative risk evaluations, and provide strategic support for businesses in the United States and globally.Key responsibilities involve researching and advancing catastrophe modeling methods, assessing natural risks using proprietary or commercial modeling software, as well as open-source data and models, ensuring compliance with corporate capacity guidelines, and delivering timely analyses to inform key stakeholders.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESInclude the following, (other duties may be assigned):Conduct research by reviewing academic and industry publications, as well as evaluating vendor and open-source models, to support business stakeholders in managing and mitigating peril risks effectively.Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements, integrate risk perspectives into vendor models, and establish optimal exposure data practices, with emphasis on extreme weather-related perils like hurricanes, tornadoes, wildfires, and floods.Partner with business units to develop consistent peril and hazard underwriting standards and guidelines.Prepare and verify exposure data,ç´¢èµ”æ•°æ®å’Œå¯¹å‡†ç¡®æ€§çš„å»ºæ¨¡å‡è®¾ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨ä¾›åº”å•†å’Œå¼€æºæ¨¡å‹è¿›è¡Œé£é™©é‡åŒ–çš„åŠ©æ‰‹ï¼› analyze and interpret results, and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders for informed decision-making.Model, analyze, and validate outputs for portfolio or account submissions.Monitor catastrophe analytics, identify potential issues, and offer recommendations to key stakeholders.Design, implement, and maintain an exposure and reporting dashboard.Provide support for product development, filing processes, and responses to major catastrophe events.Facilitate model adoption and oversee change management processes.Investigate and address modeling inquiries.Drive innovation and enhance internal tools and modeling practices.Compile and share information on perils, catastrophe events, and industry data or reports with key stakeholders within the programs division.Other duties and responsibilities as neededQUALIFICATIONSProficiency in Microsoft Office suite, database, and programming skills (SQL, R, Pythonï¼ŒExcel VBAï¼‰ï¼›é—ªäº®æˆ–åŠ›é‡â€¦
